instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the related research for determining sugar content and firmness of Fuji apples produced in different areas of Shaanxi Province, China?
Output: The research used full spectra of Fuji apples produced in different areas of Shaanxi Province, China.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the related research for determining sugar content and firmness of Fuji apples produced in different areas of Shaanxi Province, China?
Output: Successive projections algorithm (SPA) was used to select characteristic wavelengths (CWs) from pretreated full spectra for sugar content and firmness determination in the related research.

instruction: What metric was chosen and how far can this metric go in the related research for determining sugar content and firmness of Fuji apples produced in different areas of Shaanxi Province, China?
Output: The metric chosen in the research exploring the potential applications of portable spectrometers in determining sugar content and firmness of Fuji apples produced in different areas of Shaanxi Province, China was the determination performance. This metric was used to evaluate the performance of different models (MLR, PLSR, GRNN, and ELM) in predicting sugar content and firmness. The research found that PLSR-SPA had the best determination performance for both sugar content and firmness. However, the extent to which this metric can go in the research is not specified in the given text.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the related research for determining sugar content and firmness of Fuji apples produced in different areas of Shaanxi Province, China?
Output: The machine learning models used in the research were multiple linear regression (MLR), partial least squares regression (PLSR), general regression neural network (GRNN), and extreme learning machine (ELM).

instruction: Can the results of the in the related research for determining sugar content and firmness of Fuji apples produced in different areas of Shaanxi Province be generalized to other types of fruits or agricultural products?
Output: No, the results of this study cannot be generalized to other types of fruits or agricultural products. The study specifically focuses on Fuji apples produced in four counties of Shaanxi Province, China. The characteristics and properties of different fruits and agricultural products can vary significantly, so it is not appropriate to assume that the findings from this study would apply to other types of fruits or agricultural products without further research and investigation.
